lead_paragraph: To the Editor: Not every Indian agrees with Arundhati Roy's anti-American polemics (''An Indian Novelist Turns Her Wrath on the U.S.,'' news article, Nov. 3). The problem is that India's English press is still dominated by an anti-American leftist element that has long controlled our media (as indicated by the number, and vehemence, of anti-American articles since Sept. 11). This America-bashing is the main cause of such antiwar sentiments.
abstract: Gopi Krishna Maliwal letter comments on anti-American polemics of leading Indian novelist Arundhati Roy against US military action in Afghanistan; holds Roy represents leftist views of Indian press
